page.title: 01Our Block-East of Girvan
page.content: Our Domesday Block lies immediately {east of the town of Girvan,in south {Ayrshire}Through the northern part of our Block flows the River Girvan which is quite wide and slow flowing as it nears the sea. The land on either side of the river is low lying although it rises quite steeply to the south to form hills such as{Brae Hill,Saugh Hill and {Camregan Hill.} Down these hills run fast flowing burns such as the Penwhapple Burn which joins the River Girvan near{Old Dailly. The main land use in the area is farming,with dairy and beef cows grazing on the valley bottom and sheep on the higher slopes,but there is also some industry in the northwest corner. Apart from the farms the only settlement is the hamlet of Old Dailly although{Penkill Castle}is occupied.
